* * *

üìß Send‚úó Cancel

[Skip to content](https://www.hirehop.com/blog/how-to-replace-the-old-uae-dirham-currency-symbol-with-the-dirham-symbol-in-html-documents/#content)

On 27 March 2025 the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates [announced a new currency symbol](https://www.centralbank.ae/media/ckkp3s3f/cbuae-unveils-new-dirham-symbol-en.pdf) to be used for the UAE Dirham, from the old ‚ÄúUAE‚Äù or ‚ÄúÿØÿ•‚Äù to the new ‚Äú![](https://www.hirehop.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/uae-dirham.png)‚Äú. The issue is that for this new currency symbol, there is no unicode text character for use in HTML, or any other type of document come to that, so it needs to be added in another way.

To overcome this issue, something called an SVG image can be used instead.¬† The advatage of using an SVG is that it scales just like fonts, is exactly how the new Dirham symbol should look and it is very easy to implement into HTML text.

## How to statically add the new Dirham symbol within text

Firstly we will create the SVG in CSS so that it is always applied to an <img> image element with a ‚Äúaed‚Äù class like so :

```
<style type="text/css">
img.aed{
    height:0.7em;
    width:auto;
    content: url("data:image/svg+xml; base64,");
}
</style>

<body>
   Cost <img class="aed">12345
</body>
```

## Replacing the existing ‚ÄúÿØÿ•‚Äù symbol in documents

As you can‚Äôt assign the new symbol to the currency settings in HireHop yet (only because the unicode character doesn‚Äôt exist), a simple solution in HireHop documents is to replace the old symbol (or any other specific symbol) with an <img> element using JavaScript and including the CSS above.¬† In essence, we replace all ‚ÄúÿØÿ•‚Äù with <img class=‚Äùaed‚Äù> within the document:

```
<script>
   // Change the document once the document has finished loading
   window.onload = function(){
      document.querySelectorAll("body *").forEach(function (el) {
         if (el.children.length===0 && el.innerHTML.includes("ÿØÿ•")) {
            el.innerHTML = el.innerHTML.replace(/ÿØÿ•/g, '<img class="aed">');
         }
      });
   }
</script>

```

Many users have created some amazing documents for use in HireHop, utilizing HTML5, JavaScript and CSS functionality.¬† Due to the lack of this unicode UTF8 character, users can‚Äôt just say use this character instead, as the character doesn‚Äôt exit, so this is the best and easiest solution for now, until such time that the character is released in the unicode character set.
